description.value:
The kraken makes three tentacle attacks, each of which it can replace with one use of Fling.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

Melee Weapon Attack: +17 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: [[/damage 3d8 + @mod type=piercing average=true]] damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature &Reference[grappled]{grappled} by the kraken, that creature is swallowed, and the grapple ends. While swallowed, the creature is &Reference[blinded]{blinded} and &Reference[restrained]{restrained}, it has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the kraken, and it takes [[/damage 12d6 type=acid average=true]] damage at the start of each of the kraken's turns.

If the kraken takes 50 damage or more on a single turn from a creature inside it, the kraken must succeed on a [[/save con 25 format=long]] at the end of that turn or regurgitate all swallowed creatures, which fall &Reference[prone]{prone} in a space within 10 feet of the kraken. If the kraken dies, a swallowed creature is no longer &Reference[restrained]{restrained} by it and can escape from the corpse using 15 feet of movement, exiting &Reference[prone]{prone}.

The [[lookup @name]] attacks with its [[lookup @item.name]].

Melee Weapon Attack: +17 to hit, reach 30 ft., one target. Hit: [[/damage 3d6 + @mod type=bludgeoning average=true]] damage, and the target is &Reference[grappled]{grappled} (escape DC 18). Until this grapple ends, the target is &Reference[restrained]{restrained}. The kraken has ten tentacles, each of which can grapple one target.

The [[lookup @name]] attacks with its [[lookup @item.name]].

One Large or smaller object held or creature &Reference[grappled]{grappled} by the kraken is thrown up to 60 feet in a random direction and knocked &Reference[prone]{prone}. If a thrown target strikes a solid surface, the target takes [[/damage 1d6 type=bludgeoning average=true]] damage for every 10 feet it was thrown. If the target is thrown at another creature, that creature must succeed on a [[/save dex 18 format=long]] or take the same damage and be knocked &Reference[prone]{prone}.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]] and a save is required.

The kraken magically creates three bolts of &Reference[lightning]{lightning}, each of which can strike a target the kraken can see within 120 feet of it. A target must make a [[/save dex 23 format=long]], taking [[/damage 4d10 type=lightning average=true]] damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]] and a save is required.

Lair Actions

On initiative count 20 (losing initiative ties), the kraken takes a lair action to cause one of the following magical effects:

  • A strong current moves through the kraken’s lair. Each creature within 60 feet of the kraken must succeed on a [[/save str 23 format=long]] or be pushed up to 60 feet away from the kraken. On a success, the creature is pushed 10 feet away from the kraken.
  • Creatures in the water within 60 feet of the kraken have vulnerability to &Reference[lightning]{lightning} damage until initiative count 20 on the next round.
  • The water in the kraken’s lair becomes electrically charged. All creatures within 120 feet of the kraken must succeed on a [[/save con 23 format=long]], taking [[/damage 3d6 type=lightning average=true]] damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

Regional Effects

The region containing a kraken’s lair is warped by the creature’s blasphemous presence, creating the following magical effects:

  • The kraken can alter the weather at will in a 6-mile radius centered on its lair. The effect is identical to the control weather spell.
  • Water elemental;Water elementals coalesce within 6 miles of the lair. These elementals can’t leave the water and have &Reference[int]{Intelligence} and &Reference[cha]{Charisma} scores of 1 (−5).
  • Aquatic creatures within 6 miles of the lair that have an &Reference[int]{Intelligence} score of 2 or lower are &Reference[charmed]{charmed} by the kraken and aggressive toward intruders in the area.

When the kraken dies, all of these regional effects fade immediately.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

A Kraken’s Lair

A kraken lives in dark depths, usually a sunken rift or a cavern filled with detritus, treasure, and wrecked ships.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

The kraken can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action option can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. The kraken regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

Tentacle Attack or Fling. The kraken makes one tentacle attack or uses its Fling.

&Reference[lightning]{Lightning} Storm (Costs 2 Actions). The kraken uses &Reference[lightning]{Lightning} Storm.

Ink Cloud (Costs 3 Actions). While underwater, the kraken expels an ink cloud in a 60-foot radius. The cloud spreads around corners, and that area is heavily obscured to creatures other than the kraken. Each creature other than the kraken that ends its turn there must succeed on a [[/save con 23 format=long]], taking [[/damage 3d10 type=poison average=true]] damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. A strong current disperses the cloud, which otherwise disappears at the end of the kraken's next turn.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

The kraken makes one tentacle attack or uses its Fling.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

The kraken uses &Reference[lightning]{Lightning} Storm.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

While underwater, the kraken expels an ink cloud in a 60-foot radius. The cloud spreads around corners, and that area is heavily obscured to creatures other than the kraken. Each creature other than the kraken that ends its turn there must succeed on a [[/save con 23 format=long]], taking [[/damage 3d10 type=poison average=true]] damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. A strong current disperses the cloud, which otherwise disappears at the end of the kraken's next turn.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]] and a save is required.

Amphibious. The kraken can breathe air and water.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

Freedom of Movement. The kraken ignores difficult terrain, and magical effects can't reduce its speed or cause it to be &Reference[restrained]{restrained}. It can spend 5 feet of movement to escape from nonmagical restraints or being &Reference[grappled]{grappled}.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

Siege Monster. The kraken deals double damage to objects and structures.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].
